subtitle: Hello again everyone, I want to share something in my life and my journey
that I've held a lot of value in it's not something that I was taught from anywhere but
something i just found myself doing naturally because i sensed that it was right... for most of my
spiritual journey and what i deliberately did was not share any of my astral projection experiences
for many years; as a lot of you know i started having these experiences consciously over 11 years
ago now and it was only up until 10 months ago that i began to share these experiences on this
channel and in my book, so don't misinterpret the title of this video, yes i am telling you to stop
sharing your experiences but i'm more saying: stop sharing them so carelessly without any mindfulness
and i'm saying this so that if you exercise this you may be able to have experiences
more often - now i'm going to explain this but remember what i'm saying here is not to tell
you what to do, the point is by contemplating all of this it should encourage you to share or not
share your experiences in a more conscious way and we're going to understand why this is important
for many people out there that i've observed and generally for people new to all of this
a quick thank you to Mike, Lennart, and dixie who joined on Patreon be sure to
join on discord as we have a live Q&A voice chat this Sunday, as we do every month, if you want to
support these videos too just see the Patreon link below ~ now let's explain this quite basic teaching
about why one should be careful when sharing experiences; as a spiritual aspirant, practitioner
meditator, begins to make progress they naturally start to have experiences, spiritual experiences
one of them of course being astral projection, now when they have these experiences for the
first time many people become so excited that they start to share these experiences willy-nilly with
everyone, without considering whether they should do that or not, and of course many of us have been
there right? including myself when i had my first experience i told my close friends and family but
i quickly sensed why i shouldn't have done that and obviously i share many of my experiences now
right so we'll see what i really mean here and on that note there are still many experiences i
have chosen not to share because i really have no reason to and or they were very personal intimate
experiences which were very special to me you know to me alone and also some
of these experiences are probably not really believable too, you know my focus my journey and
purpose here is to not to be of controversy with entertaining you with experiences but my ultimate
purpose is to help you experience this dimension of life for yourself, especially because there
are so many experienced people out there who know about disability but don't bother to teach it and
i think that's a real shame, that is what has inspired me to start all of this
writing books and making these episodes in the first place... so yes and you know there's a reason
why astral projection was kept secret and only talked about in occult circles for many centuries
until recent times with the interconnectedness of today; that's the beautiful thing about the modern
world that many spiritual secrets have all been brought to light, however a consequence of that is
people easily devalue or overlook these spiritual mysteries, so even though these spiritual mysteries
are largely in the public domain we should also value and honor our spiritual experiences
like secret treasures and not be too liberal with them because let's face it we're still living
in a deeply sleeping matrix with most of humanity extremely unconscious and this even exists in many
spiritual groups and even in astral projection groups, so i'm going to elaborate of course...
to understand what i'm saying here let's keep in mind and remember that the greatest spiritual
aspiration in spirituality is for our mind which is currently full of ego to merge with the soul
our consciousness this is a challenging thing to do because we have the ego, the ego distorts
and covers our perception with mud making us blind to the greater reality of life, of consciousness, if
you've ever heard of looking behind the 'veil' the veil IS the ego as seen on this diagram
on the screen to merge with the soul our consciousness which you could also call
god or the self is to realize it, hence the term self-realization, or god-realization and so to
realize this higher nature it is natural for us to begin having spiritual experiences obviously
one of them being astral projection, perhaps go and see my video about enlightenment and
going beyond the veil, so as we all know there is a certain struggle on the path to attaining
such experiences right? we're all familiar with this it's not a simple task well at least to the
ego it is perceived as a struggle right, our goal, our striving, is to go beyond the veil of the ego
or more precisely to dissolve the ego or at least minimize it so that it's not always in the way
and this is the important point here; we strive to go beyond the ego but when we start sharing
experiences it's very easy to go back into the state of ego that's the problem - that's what you
should be careful about when sharing experiences, there are many types of ego many facets of it,
many faces of it in fact, you know just the normal egoic traits of ordinary everyday people but
a spiritual ego is one of the most trickiest to handle or even become aware of in the first place
especially if you are a beginner at all of this so this is really crucial advice to any novice really
it should be one of the basic guidelines before attaining spiritual experiences, be sure to check
out my episode about the spiritual ego as well, so let me be more specific here there are various
reasons why you should exercise mindfulness before sharing experiences and just one of those reasons
are; talking about them simply too soon after you've experienced it, let me explain
when you begin to start working towards these experiences you're meditating staying grounded
and then suddenly one day you have an interesting experience but since because of your fascination
and perhaps also desperation to attain these experiences you cling onto the past memory of
that experience and hold it tightly smothering it with all of your over analyzations and
then spend also a lot of time sharing your experiences with others asking things like
whether it was a lucid dream or astral projection instead of working towards more experiences
and gaining this knowledge for yourself, so you know where has your practice gone now where has
your meditative state gone that allowed you to go into that state of mind to astral project in the
first place you've become too busy concerned and preoccupied with an experience that you may have
thought was significant and honestly if you're that doubtful about it then it probably wasn't
even that significant so really what i'm talking about here is how the ego arises when sharing
spiritual experiences, or more precisely, it is the ego that usually wants to share experiences
and as i've said in the past the ego is not just one thing but a plethora of different voices and
opinions and emotions within us and so one ego feels frustrated with not being able to
discern whether an experience was legitimate or what it means and thus begins to pester others
instead of that individual recognizing that they simply need to continue their
practice to deepen their intuition, wisdom and also gain more experiences, let me tell you if you
persist deeply, sincerely, you can get to a point where intuition can become a vast pool of direct
knowledge this is more for a later episode but the main point here is to value practice over
sharing experiences, being confused is essentially an egoic state the, intellect is unenlightened and
thinking about it too much doesn't help we just need to continue practicing, so another reason why
we should avoid sharing these experiences and you may have guessed it by now it's quite an obvious
one is, pride, i don't think this aspect needs much explanation right many people share experiences
and boast and show off to prove to others that they're magical or have powers, so you see as i
said earlier the high aspiration of a practitioner, a yogi, a devotee, is to merge with what is known as
'Atman' the soul; and we do this by cleaning the veil and muck of the ego, yet if you have an experience
and you add more muck with the ego of pride, giving your ego more sense of self rather than sensing
the divine, then this is just counterproductive it's a totally illogical thing to do do you think
your consciousness is going to grant you more experiences if you're adding more pride every
time you have an experience? absolutely not, because clearly spiritual experiences adds more ego to you
and your consciousness wants you to awaken - not become more egoic... in this sense for many people
astral projection does not become a tool for self-realization but devolves into a false sense
of spiritual superiority ~ it produces in the mind a false sense of importance i'm reminded once again
of the native American shaman that i've quoted a lot in the past who taught that self-importance is
the force generated by man's self-image, by our image of ourselves, and so the path to awakening is
literally about dissolving self-importance as he famously said; "self-importance is man's greatest
enemy, what weakens him is feeling offended by the deeds and misdeeds of his fellow men
self-importance requires that one spend most of one's life offended by something or someone, as
long as a man feels that he is the most important thing in the world he cannot really appreciate the
world around him"... so there are many examples of how this emotion of pride can be sensed within
it could say things like "wow i had this experience i'm so much better than others i must be
so awakened and pure that god gifts me with these experiences" or perhaps you have experiences with
guides and spirits etc and you wake up and say "wow i'm so important i must be a vessel of truth
for humanity" you know "i am the chosen one" right "i have spiritual powers, god consciousness" these
are all just illusions and add to the veil of ego which blinds your perception and sense of
the true divine within which is beyond all of these egoic thoughts and sense of self
these aren't just egos of pride but can also give birth to arrogance, vanity and self-centeredness
and just too much self-involvement, you're making love with yourself right...
so remember that whatever you experience however blissful however transcendental beautiful and
profound is also found within every living being, within every person, every atom in existence to
separate yourself as better than others is to take yourself out of this great field of
oneness... and to go even deeper here and what i really want to teach is that it's not actually
about whether you tell people or not, no, you can practice not telling anyone about your experiences
and still have those feelings of pride, vanity and superiority, you see? it all starts from within
whether you tell people or not; it's not just about what you say with your mouth it's about what you
think and feel -- remember that spirituality and experiences are for you and you alone nobody else
there's nothing to prove to anyone... another issue here amongst all of this is that people also get
jealous and competitive astral projection is a very sought after experience these days you know
and many people become desperate to achieve it that jealousy can turn to hate, confusions and
feelings of superiority and inferiority, especially when experiences aren't shared in an enlightening
and kind way and there's also the problem of sharing negative experiences in a fear-mongering
way too, so we have a whole mess of implications here but at the basis of all this we should value
and honor as a kind of devotee of consciousness right, we should honor and value our experiences
it's like looking for treasure for many years and when you finally find it, would you really just
call every person you know and tell them about it? or even worse go online in public
take a picture of your treasure and just tell a bunch of strangers about it publicly; half
of them won't even appreciate your experience, your treasure, and just tell you it's nothing
it means nothing right? they don't value you, they don't believe you, they don't take you seriously,
they don't respect you, they don't even know who you are... i've talked about this before about the
destructive nature of the current collective consciousness of most of humanity perhaps you
disagree, perhaps you want to believe that humanity is this beautiful loving species that you can
trust no, posting your experiences online is like finding that beautiful treasure which is like a
delicate flower gifted from a celestial angel and shoving it into hell for demons to eat and tear up
now perhaps you're strong of mind and don't mind that but a big danger here for many people
and it happens to many people i've seen it too many times is that the doubts, misinformation
and skepticisms of other people become your own doubts and skepticisms and misunderstandings... so we
have to be careful who we share experiences with to talk more crudely it's like people taking a
dump on your experiences, a dump on your wonderful treasure and you know personally i sensed this
weakness in me earlier on on my path and one of the reasons i never shared my experiences
was because i knew that if i did i would have gotten that ignorant confused look you get from
people who don't understand what you're talking about and back then the thought of people doing
that when i'm sharing something more valuable than anything humanity has ever discovered
made me feel awful so i stayed extremely private but now i gathered some experiences some
understanding and today i obviously couldn't care less what people say because i know what
i experienced but for some especially people new to the spiritual path it can be damaging to your
practice especially when this sort of devotion and knowing of the higher dimensions of consciousness
are not solidified deeply in yourself, and instead of cultivating self-realization
you cultivate self-doubt instead, remember your individual expansion of consciousness
does not mix with collective consciousness; this is very important to understand if you are to
go beyond the rest of humanity and go to these other worlds that are not
related to this collective world we physically live in, so among all of these colorations
these aspects and traits of the ego manifesting when sharing experiences there's one specific
thing we have to put value in in order to make sure we don't lose ourselves too much in the ego
when having experiences and it's this; this is kind of my own way i recognize my own divinity
and honor it... we, or rather, the individual "I"; the personality you call you, does not astral project
okay, we do not have this ability the "I" does not have this ability, consciousness does
higher power does, the nature of God is what allows us to enter other worlds, we should honor that and
recognize that as a fundamental truth, the ego does not astral project, the ego does absolutely nothing
when the foundation of our very being opens up to the greater reality which is already there
then such experiences of the divine open up, that is all, it is always available
but it is the ego that gets in our way and skews reality with its misperceptions and unconscious
dreams, so we do not astral project the higher power within us does, our higher self does, that's
how you could see it as well, and so you see if you become a person who says "I" am an astral projector
"I" have this ability "I" know how to astral project "I" control all of this and make this happen
that is a complete fallacy of the mind, the "I" does nothing; astral projection is a completely
natural phenomena of consciousness all that the "I" does is get in the way and so if you think "I"
does all of this, thinks it knows how to do it, then it also feels responsibility or weight or a burden
to keep up with practicing astral projection, it feels like it has to control everything and then
when you can't astral project on some days the "I" starts overthinking saying things like "oh
this method didn't work on this day because i did this or "I" did bad things on this day so "I" couldn't
do it etc etc right? but the reality is the "I" is just making a whole lot of noise to distract
you with all of its thoughts emotions, sense of self, that's the only ever real problem... now i know
this is all perhaps a little heavy i'm not saying sharing experiences is always bad of course not
and as you know from this channel i've shared many of my experiences too you know for example
swearing is generally considered a bad thing right? perhaps even sinful but really no
saying bad words swear words is not bad but what's important is the spirit in which we swear
it's the way we swear and how we feel when we say it that determines whether it causes disturbances
or negative energies within ourselves or others, in the same way; the spirit of how we share spiritual
experiences can detriment our progress through pride, superiority, competitiveness and other egoic
confusions, and just to be clear it's absolutely fine to share experiences but we have to always
ask why we share them, this is about becoming a more equilibrated and self-aware human being
i put the title of this video quite direct because this is not taught anywhere and i
think this is a really important thing to consider and i have seen it in other people and myself too
so as a general guideline when should we share experiences? when we have a genuine calling
from our hearts feelings of love right to inspire others, to be of service to others, it may also be
to teach and enlighten others, it may also be in the pure act of simply sharing with others right
to share is a beautiful thing but many don't share; they boast, or are in confusion that's the point
here and before you share ask yourself why you are sharing is it out of boasting, showing off, pride? or
is it a genuine service to humanity to help inspire or enlighten or do you also need
sincere help that you feel you really need, you know usually when i share my own experiences
is with the intent to inspire or enlighten people about certain things and you can ask yourself you
know if you're writing experiences or saying them ask yourself if someone opposed you would you feel
offended? who feels offended? is it your pride? you know what's really going on here? are you really
enlightened about what you're sharing? so it's a very simple lesson here amongst all of this;
maintain your inner silence silence is also a dimension of intelligence in itself
and when we're comfortable in it it's a gateway to intuition and continuing your practice more deeply
and also some advice to more advanced people on this path because i know you're out there
listening but don't comment on the videos or anything because there's not much you need to say
consider this; you being more advanced can begin to meet certain masters and guides
and attend perhaps secret classes in the astral - they may want to tell you certain things
even secret things do you think that they would share those things with you if you were the type
of person to pass on their message in a way that they didn't want or if you're the type of person
to just tell other people's secrets and just blurt out every experience all the time, no, of course
they wouldn't and these type of beings know what kind of person you are even before meeting you
if you're not capable of shutting your mouth after every experience and you have this kind
of verbal diarrhea you are most likely missing the point of your experiences, practice at least
keeping 50% or more of your experiences to yourself only share those you genuinely need help with or
feel a genuine sincere calling from your heart to inspire and help others check yourself if you're
doing it because of pride because you want to seem experienced, wise, holier than thou as they say, then
this is not the way and i can assure you you will have less experiences as a result, this is not a
belief to scare you, this is just a science of the mind; as you can see on the diagram on the screen
we have spiritual practice, we go into higher consciousness by being able to go beyond the ego
but then we descend back into the ego when we feel prideful about our experiences again, and clearly
we need to stay in higher consciousness ~ and so yes if you recognize some of this in yourself
and how your ego can become bigger sometimes when you share things with your friends
this is not to be seen as good or bad but just part of your practice; if you are honest with
yourself and feel you have some of these egoic movements within you, simply exercise awareness
over it so that it doesn't control you and take root within you all the time going forward
this is just part of our practice, it's part of spiritual growth, unfortunately a lot of people
don't recognize this and get stuck on the path so here i am trying to help... and so you can see now
if you have an experience and wake up try not to be so surprised, fascinated and hypnotized by the
experience but instead remain impartial like a Zen monk as i always say and just continue practicing
then you will easily continue to have more experiences you will stay back in the non-egoic
higher state of consciousness that allowed you to have those experiences in the first place, and you
know i say all of this as part of the movements and temptations of my own mind too you know i make
these videos, i'm writing books, and i get questions and praises from people every day and many say
Gene you are amazing, wonderful you have these powers, bless me with guidance and all of this
you know and i feel like saying please just stop you know stop giving your energy, stop projecting a
sense of divinity to others and not to yourself; i am nothing special whatever i've experienced
whatever i've realized or know, you have all of these things within you too we all hold the
same level of God-potential because we are all just nothing right, insignificant pieces of dust
floating in the ocean of cosmic infinity, and so on this note as i said at the beginning be careful
of who you share these experiences with and hence this is just one reason why I created the private
Astral Doorway Patreon and Discord group so that people can feel safe to share their knowledge and
experiences with others, who will value them as much as they do, that's how it's designed to be,
and as i said earlier asking people publicly about your experiences isn't the best way to go about it;
as i said you should just continue your practice and those experiences will make sense in time,
but if you really genuinely and sincerely need help then you should ideally ask someone who is
more experienced and has the wisdom to give you the proper guidance for you to exercise a deeper
understanding about what happened, and of course that's something I often do for people in the
group, okay so remember this entire episode is not just black and white, it's not good or bad, it's not
a rule set for you to just to not share your experiences;
use self-awareness, self-observation if you are coming from an honest and sincere place
then you're probably fine, okay this is just to give you mindful tips to stay grounded
in your practice so that you can continue to have more astral projection experiences;
many people always ask me "Gene I only had one experience and can't make it happen again", well
consider what's been said here perhaps, okay so if you have questions feel free to ask or as
always if you have some wisdom on this topic too you're always invited to share with everyone below
and thank you if you've stayed with me throughout this whole thing listening
it is really hard to keep some explanations concise because i could probably still continue
elaborating for a long time but in any case thank you and I will see you on the next episode
